isis.stitle: TSI 02-16-05 - Cab Door Opening, Cracking In Upper Rear Corner

subjectgroup.subject: Cab Door Opening, Cracking In Upper Rear Corner

geninfo.para: Reports have been received that repeated door closings on the above models can produce cracking of the upper rear door opening along the drip rail. In extreme cases, cracking may continue down the glamour edge of the opening from the drip rail. See Figure 1. This process is to be applied only to those cabs, driver and/or passenger sides that exhibit any of these cracks.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Arrows Designate Areas Where Cracks may Occur

svcproc.stitle: TSI 02-16-05 - Cab Door Opening, Cracking In Upper Rear Corner
svcproc.title: Vehicle Preparation

step1.para: Prior to beginning the actual repair, make certain that a suitable, non-flammable barrier is in place to assure that grinding dust and sparks, as well as welding sparks do not enter cab and ignite flammable materials such as seats and floor mats.
Pull door opening trim away from opening flange at least six inches either side of area where bracket is to be welded.

caution.para: To prevent damage to vehicle modules/computer circuitry disconnect both the positive and negative battery cables from the battery before welding on the vehicle. Attach the welder ground cable as close as possible to the part being welded.

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Alwats wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Disconnect positive and negative battery terminal and all electronic grounding circuits in accordance with TSI 98-08-01 prior to welding.

svcproc.stitle: TSI 02-16-05 - Cab Door Opening, Cracking In Upper Rear Corner
svcproc.title: Bracket Installation

step1.para: Position bracket (left or right) in place at door opening corner (Figure 2).

Inspect fit of bracket. Make certain that there isn’t any sealant in corner preventing the bracket from seating properly. If the angle of flanges prevents the bracket from seating tightly into corner, bend flanges slightly to minimize air gap between bracket and door opening. Clamp bracket in place (Figure 2).
Mark all twelve holes in bracket onto the door opening using a marking pencil. These marks locate the areas where puddle welds are required to attach the bracket to the cab skin (Figure 3).
Remove bracket and assure that all welding areas are properly marked.
If crack has progressed from horizontal to vertical and is visible at rear edge of opening (see Figure 1), remove any sealant from cracked area and grind paint ¼ inch back from cracked corner.
Grind paint from the marked areas to assure good welding. Use a small diameter disk to minimize unnecessary removal of paint or metal thickness (Figure 4).
Refit bracket to opening and make sure that no cab paint is showing through the holes in the bracket. Make sure this is true of all holes, horizontal and vertical. Reclamp bracket in place.

note.para: Use clean "C" clamp to attach bracket to door opening. Attach welder ground to "C" clamp.

warning.para: Invisible ultraviolet and infrared rays emitted in welding can injure unprotected eyes and skin. To avoid personal injury a welders helmet with dark colored filter lenses of the proper density must be used. GTAW or TIG welding will produce intense radiation, therefore, filter plate lenses of the deepest shade providing adequate visibility are recommended. It is also recommended that persons working in the welding area wear flash safety glasses and protective clothing.

step1.para: Set up MIG welder and test on similar metal thickness to assure a full puddle weld between bracket and cab sheet metal without producing excessive heat to cause a burn through of the sheet metal.

Carefully weld all twelve holes in bracket to producing a full puddle weld in each location. If vertical crack was observed and metal prepared per instructions in Step 5. above, carefully weld edge of bracket to both sides of crack (Figure 5).
Grind weld puddles flush with bracket and dress up vertical weld if performed (Figure 6).

svcproc.stitle: TSI 02-16-05 - Cab Door Opening, Cracking In Upper Rear Corner
svcproc.title: Sealing and Painting

step1.para: Remove sealant from drip rail in area above weld if it appears to be bubbled or lifted from rail. Remove only the damaged area.

Apply Fusor T-123 sealant or equivalent to drip rail and all exposed surfaces where bracket meets the sheet metal. Make sure sealant will prevent moisture from entering gap between bracket and cab. Find Fusor products on ISIS supplier link.
Spot paint repaired areas per Master Service Manual, Group 16, S16002, Paint and Refinishing.
